document.title: Quick Reference Guide FOR THE NORTH CAROLINA STANDARD COURSE OF STUDY

7F0B5B006DB04872B66E7BF38DCD8278.description:
Justifying the appropriate choice of measures of center using the shape of
the data distribution.

29C857B39DA54252A2190D371B797CC8.description:
Giving quantitative measures of center, describing variability, and any
overall pattern, and noting any striking deviations

ABE8D19A20FF4AF09C7F687BA28FA838.description:
Communicating the nature of the attribute under investigation, how it was
measured, and the units of measurement.

D6E3C6ABA96A43E1822E9CD0B18811DF.description: Reporting the number of observations in dot plots and histograms.

A03CF27ADFA74AC0A48A229F7B5E4467.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.

681FC3A04DFB44679604E5F4AA1D3F3E.description: Compare the attributes of different representations of the same data.

78B005AF6E0B43B89949232A56D7E21C.description: Use dot plots, histograms, and box plots to represent data.

D34F8BEAD63849ABB208D14131D61288.description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line.

A4C4E31E4F814C249DFFDF0D1F3F848A.description:
Understand that describing the variability of a data set is needed to
distinguish between data sets in the same scale, by comparing graphical
representations of different data sets in the same scale that have similar
measures of center, but different spreads.

C2D286851C164BDC890EAB68DA57F1BD.description:
Understand the median as a measure of center that is the numerical middle
of an ordered data set.

EF9EC077DBD349D8A57668255E0EB8D7.description:
Understand that a mean is a measure of center that represents a balance
point or fair share of a data set and can be influenced by the presence of
extreme values within the data set.

42B40DB2AEC54815A7F7368A0B62EA7A.description:
Determine the measure of center of a data set and understand that it is a
single number that summarizes all the values of that data set.

EDA4692EB89C40DEA7CFEC9D82F6C422.description:
Understand that both a measure of center and a description of variability should
be considered when describing a numerical data set.

4A6518C021BF4508B546565B7123736E.description:
Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a
distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

12068958C5D74CAD8B429EB1EC944919.description:
Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data
related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.

7F8F1FBB193548C7B238F996389152F2.description:
Represent right prisms and right pyramids using nets made up of rectangles and
triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these
techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

D880BDFC2B1945F7A2EF656BB90FF786.description:
Using coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first
coordinate or the same second coordinate.

AC33FFF166B5439F85236721B680A907.description: Drawing polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices.

9948F7BA05BE4EEBA1B47D9309B01475.description: Use the coordinate plane to solve real-world and mathematical problems by:

D357F563886247C2A30EE1D471158207.description:
Apply and extend previous understandings of the volume of a right rectangular
prism to find the volume of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths.
Apply this understanding to the context of solving real-world and mathematical
problems.

DF922F38DE1943A1B37441D78CF0AFE2.description:
Find the area of special quadrilaterals and polygons by decomposing into
triangles or rectangles.

3562E88A436044A4AB7F46DBFC9CE867.description:
Find the area of triangles by composing into rectangles and decomposing into
right triangles.

15A3B55C14CF4504A92EF868E8012667.description: Create geometric models to solve real-world and mathematical problems to:

3DB08083B61C4DBB843945A1C9A3F30C.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.

9B876022C2224CFB86AD1CD09D37892F.description:
Analyze the relationship between quantities in different representations
(context, equations, tables, and graphs).

39D89CCDECE242FBB50E3A2C97570B2C.description:
Using variables to represent two quantities in a real-world or mathematical
context that change in relationship to one another.

4BD6B21635554075A3FEBA8C68D6874C.description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships by:

5CDD7F7828DE455EA0896FCEFE4CF82E.description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.

81D1F16425E3487199DC161FE8EEFE57.description: Representing solutions of inequalities on number line diagrams.

C8C806EE101E43FE83FAB79C5CF33F3F.description:
Recognizing that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely
many solutions.

66441C087FF445AC86AEEBC7A62795E0.description:
Writing an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or
condition in a real-world or mathematical problem.

7F58A90143AE44A0A800132C1F0257F9.description:
Using substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set
makes an inequality true.

0B2418393A4E4585A7113FFAA8E0DA44.description: p • x = q for cases in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

32B9A0CC04954EB6A259C049EA125DCE.description: x + p = q in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational numbers; and,

F46838FFF34246AAB1F52E5791ED7304.description:
Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations
of the form:

562FF0DA39864421AEE52EA283FD89DE.description:
Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a
real-world or mathematical problem.

FE3CE5A0BA3845B7A3FD1D82FF0EE1AF.description:
Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes
an equation true.

884794B7C0D444F9B67D02F2C20067BB.description: Reason about and solve one-variable equations.

E1F20BD9781E4C0D815F3F55C54749D7.description:
Identify when two expressions are equivalent and justify with
mathematical reasoning.

CEB38172D6F848E5843426058B09A875.description:
Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions
without exponents.

AF70FB41A8BF4F9AADBFFD34E7873AC8.description:
Evaluate expressions at specific values of their variables using expressions that
arise from formulas used in real-world problems.

A48D40DE72D440599EFFE1E51FD5FE5D.description:
Identify parts of an expression using mathematical terms and view one or
more of those parts as a single entity.

17A3D30F7EF542EFA0C90DBE66195544.description:
Write expressions that record operations with numbers and with letters
standing for numbers.

6A53206E010E480F9D418015F0C3FD14.description: Write, read, and evaluate algebraic expressions.

9F50B4E029D04607ABD57D91D8EBBC65.description:
Write and evaluate numerical expressions, with and without grouping symbols,
involving whole-number exponents.

0338BC6C758A46A8AB3060D83623C0BC.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.

5F47E9FEA24C45ED91BCD2BF03CB8C5F.description:
Use models to add and subtract integers from -20 to 20 and describe
real-world contexts using sums and differences.

AF2A76125D0D4B2BB9CD508508DBC848.description:
Understand subtraction of integers as adding the additive inverse,
p − q = p + (– q). Show that the distance between two integers on the
number line is the absolute value of their difference.

55D9959E77604620856BA9046587AACF.description:
Understand p + q as the number located a distance q from p, in the positive
or negative direction depending on the sign of q. Show that a number and its
additive inverse create a zero pair.

A787A60ACFC2437AA37D2FEBB3A8758A.description: Describe situations in which opposite quantities combine to make 0.

6DAC9459EBCD442C941C1A98E2B25C8F.description: Understand additive inverses when adding and subtracting integers.

A569072FBC884AD0866CEDB6FCD37EFC.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction.

5532C396D301492FA2A44EC8D0D8B800.description:
Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four
quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to
find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second
coordinate.

D27825F5CC214665A6204CB9FBEEAFF1.description:
Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in
real-world contexts.

74E7EE2E81B04732A579F8DE55C58368.description:
Interpret statements of inequality as statements about the relative position
of two numbers on a number line diagram.

6145CD98727E452FB8FB52542B73C13E.description: Find and position pairs of rational numbers on a coordinate plane.

1C1E5CB6D3854D39989EC359E140FB5A.description:
Recognize that when two ordered pairs differ only by signs, the locations of the
points are related by reflections across one or both axes.

FBE6BD4EF16C48799D505EECCBED0E66.description:
Understand signs of numbers in ordered pairs as indicating locations
in quadrants.

D02762C5514D4520A877574325255548.description: Find and position rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line.

6A183A87A81A47978B08B721AF581EA3.description:
Recognize opposite signs of numbers as indicating locations on opposite sides
of 0 and that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself.

AE2BBCA0C95C4947BD94809E3A64E0FA.description:
Understand rational numbers as points on the number line and as ordered pairs on
a coordinate plane.

7F387D9AEE294F7EADBD1BE55BBDE3AD.description: Distinguish comparisons of absolute value from statements about order.

04AF690EC48B479AB194E8FA57556AE6.description:
Interpret absolute value as magnitude for a positive or negative quantity in a
real-world context.

5BFCED3C43D44AAC965F3808F1E10413.description:
Understand the absolute value of a rational number as its distance from 0
on the number line to:

02D5181C54D445D79E73F3BD8A1AC857.description:
Represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each
situation.

194F493AB8F848219A4F876FA94BD94F.description: Describe quantities having opposite directions or values.

E2C1AEFC0F4D442980D1F8FF3AD1B287.description: Understand and use rational numbers to:

55CE709F727D424F93104C63D61A15F9.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.

9094FEA3E3A445768F145AEB31DA0C8C.description:
Find the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to
12 to add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.

9017DDEFC51A43B69C5356C688C077F4.description:
Use the greatest common factor and the distributive property to rewrite the sum
of two whole numbers, each less than or equal to 100.

9C623DC46C834C61A22ADA73DCC8E731.description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100.

CB1132F13BCF404FB98E981446F7F35F.description: Find the unique prime factorization for a whole number.

A177ACDC507D48C788A1C7BE5E0BBDBF.description: Understand and use prime factorization and the relationships between factors to:

6B95791872E946BD9477DE5DB4764570.description:
Apply and extend previous understandings of decimals to develop and fluently
use the standard algorithms for addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
of decimals.

9AC8F22B99534B2CB49EB49484832B39.description:
Fluently divide using long division with a minimum of a four-digit dividend and
interpret the quotient and remainder in context.

5BF1CBA2593D415E9F12FFEE811A910A.description: Compute fluently with multi-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.

D5438BFF531B4617B0D152220F2B6190.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving division of fractions.

1C6AA1B5788041B1917B33A70CDFF96E.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions.

CAE5B5B96E85425B8DA36A0BEDEB9235.description: Use visual models and common denominators to:

71F74A9BEB0349248A7BE306BEA7BD4B.description:
Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions
by fractions.

EC5F05CABD534C70A1C57EC7DD75F6FE.description: Finding the whole, given a part and the percent.

5CB474C47D9440BEBB1AB649E79334D2.description:
Using equivalent ratios, such as benchmark percents (50%, 25%, 10%, 5%, 1%),
to determine a part of any given quantity.

6708F00BA9EF4A5DB1F80F28ADB4B1E5.description: Understanding and finding a percent of a quantity as a ratio per 100.

6E1885A187F9463C851941038BC1392D.description: Use ratio reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems with percents by:

8E082631176049839D05BFD43444EA49.description: Plotting the pairs of values on the coordinate plane.

E1093C59D3DE49949A0DEC7BFC839DEA.description: Converting and manipulating measurements using given ratios.

4D7F60EF418747EC92934BE386CFA1E0.description: Finding missing values in the tables.

6854746EAFF542E7AD6A424C1087EB73.description: Creating and using a table to compare ratios.

C4B5570D27ED4F439CB1277A553D32B2.description:
Use ratio reasoning with equivalent whole-number ratios to solve real-world and
mathematical problems by:

89BD55B4579F49ED9F548F2132622F0D.description:
Understand that ratios can be expressed as equivalent unit ratios by finding and
interpreting both unit ratios in context.

54033D1715C645429632377BA800FD11.description: Model a ratio relationship using a variety of representations.

ED34C89E400A4EEEA5A1D28AF9F5BB22.description: Describe a ratio as a multiplicative relationship between two quantities.

1161DB85D0764EFD91E97F5FFB071FB3.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to:

24773C76BCE343B2B4706441F035171E.description: Understand ratio concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
